title: Personally I think this World's has already proven more exciting than last years
body: Just in terms of straight competition, we have upsets and comebacks left and right. I know the more jaded among you might disagree, but I think it's awesome that it's not just the "Korean and some other guys championship."

replies.body: no laneswaps so far means a much more interesting game to watch, because you get to have an early game too instead of tower trading and skipping straight to the midgame, it allows both laners and junglers to showcase their individual skills a lot more before transferring to how good their teamplay is

^^This

It makes it so much more exciting for laners to actually play versus each other in lane and watch the match-ups, then watch the transition into teamfights. Lane swaps were so boring. I am glad Riot figured out ways to avoid that being the only strategy in pro play.

In spring split and first half of summer I actually skipped to 8 minutes from the start every game (straight forwarding in steps of 1 minute to see when the first turrets have fallen and the standard lanes begin)
Worlds has finally become one great big clown fiesta. No one is safe this worlds.

Are you referring to Kills as "clown Fiesta" or just how close each team are? 
2014 Groups had a much shorter game times but with Much more kills in each game and 2015 games were a little shorter than in 2014 the kills also dipped a little. 
  This year's worlds has some of the longest games around the 38 min per game with the least amount of Kills in each game.  
                       - Don't quote me- Just going off on memory.
Every team has been widely inconsistent. You can honestly point to at least one bad performance for every team. One day a team looks great then next the look boosted and vise versa.
ah, thank you for commenting as I just didn't understand what you meant by your comment. Good stuff, Good stuff.
It's exciting because NA and wildcard regions are showing up big
*cough* and EU's choking *cough*
What's EU's favorite fish?
Flounder
Hey our team at least got 1 win and there is a decent chance will make it out of groups. Unlike some wildcard teams that got 0 wins!
Which? Both Wildcard teams are doing solidly. They're 3-3 Overall between the two of them, 2-1 + 1-2. EU is in dead last for the week, with the only teams that went 0-3

I was implying that our two teams are wildcards and that the wildcard teams are not "wildcards". 

Remember, you NA fans can be hard on our teams, but boy give us the chance and we will rip their throats apart. Its a common European tradition to rip each other's throat that we have been practicing since.... well thousants and thousants years ago.
Ah, didn't follow the joke. Thanks for explaining (this isn't actually sarcasm, despite how sarcastic it looks).
Well let's see if they can at least get out of groups. So far, NA is still holding that title alone.

I intentionally skipped out on the Pro scene this year so I could be shocked at worlds. Last year I watched just shy of every match and called ever victor that could be and it ruined the experience. Hell I should be one of the people on the desk because they haven't done shit this year but say something and get booed for failing.

But I agree with you OP. So far this has been a pretty good worlds IMO Just upset to see Doublelift say "TSM is America's team" then lose the very next match shamefully.

Honestly I just hate Doublelift now after he ditched Afro and said he was holding him back.

> [{quoted}](name=Knalxz,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=K3MBjLhU,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2016-10-03T17:34:27.748+0000)
>
> I intentionally skipped out on the Pro scene this year so I could be shocked at worlds. Last year I watched just shy of every match and called ever victor that could be and it ruined the experience. Hell I should be one of the people on the desk because they haven't done shit this year but say something and get booed for failing.
> 
> But I agree with you OP. So far this has been a pretty good worlds IMO Just upset to see Doublelift say "TSM is America's team" then lose the very next match shamefully.
> 
> Honestly I just hate Doublelift now after he ditched Afro and said he was holding him back.

Pretty sure Afro kicked him off the team, not the other way around.

That said I do think he claimed CLG was holding him back.
He said that??
It's been both exciting and terrifying for me because I get to see my main in most of the games (kennen). this means he is about to be nerfed into the ground
Nami mains feel your pain.
{{champion:136}} RIP my fabulous dragon
Right there with you, buddy. My secondary is Nami and seeing her spammed is a sign of nerfs to come :(

It's definitely one of the most exciting first weeks, but let's face it, these games don't mean as much as next weeks games when teams can be eliminated. We've seen some upsets in the first week, but as someone who remembers C9's 3-0 first week, the second week is the true litmus test of which teams are the strongest and we'll have to wait and see now.
Riot drastic changes with no prior notice are paying off. weird op new champs? Check. Hidden bugs. or should i say. Features? Check. no vision so a flashing alistar is always a possiblity? Check.

Drastic changes? The last drastic change happened over a month ago. Weird new OP champs? Alistar? Sol who has been out for six months? Syndra? The only new champ is Kled and that didn't really work out when it was attempted. Hidden bugs? I guess you got that one. Man what a terrible worlds. Sol was disabled for two days. Worst event in LoL history.

> [{quoted}](name=Mazariamonti,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=K3MBjLhU,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2016-10-03T13:19:27.118+0000)
>
>  Worst event in LoL history.

Generally refers to all of LoL history?
Ah, I was being sarcastic towards the guy who I was replying to.
My apologies then
obviously someone wasn't watching season 2 with the cheating, the crashes and the delays so long they had to find a new venue
What does season 2 have to do with season 6, exactly?
This is a gradual effect of transfers

These best of ones are getting to people. It's crazy! Some regions are more used to it than others, but when you only have one chance to get a read on a team it can hurt or help you. Next week should show who learns from their mistakes better and can execute new strategies to counter their group-mates.
Much more fun to watch. Not just for NA teams but every team in general. Loving it.

It is pretty hard to argue that it isn't more exciting seeing as how for the first time in years everyone has lost a game in groups. And it happened in the first weekend.

That and the wildcard regions showing up big.
I agree, the games have been much more interesting than years past. Seeing all the players really get into the game is something that is good for the competitive scene.

That's true, but to be fair it's not a high bar to jump over. The most exciting thing that happened last year was NA doing really, really well the first round. SKT winning it all was mostly a given, and the entire Worlds tourney was more of a formality of crowning them than an actual competition.

Not very difficult to top that snoozefest.

Groups has to be my favorite part of Worlds mainly because it's so unpredictable as far as W and L goes for each team.  
The Playoffs are great too but for the most part the better team in most cases the Asian teams will have a Series to work with and study their opponents and that's when in my opinion Worlds tends to get boring. (FOR ME MY OPINION) 

Last year was fun but this year's Worlds is 10X Better not just because of the 6-3 NA record but last year while the competition was closer than it was in previous years EVERYONE could tell SKT was going to win.

There isn't the same level of one superstar team out to wreck everyone the way there has been the last few.

World's hasn't been this open since Season 2.  (Season 2 was probably still more open though.  I will be astounded if in the long run a Korean team doesn't still take it home.)
Im just upset that my should be solid bet on SKT was killed by FW.
